page.title: 02Newcastle Transport; Byker
page.content: In Newcastle there are many different forms of transport. Most popular is land transport, the{Metro} and{buses.} The Metro works only on railway lines, underground and overground. We did a survey in{Byker}and noticed that most people found the Metro comfortable, smooth and faster than any other ride. People found buses bumpy but mainly convenient, the city centre being the most popular route. Out of those questioned most travelled to town twice a week or more using the bus for convenience. Most people used public transport twice a day. Most people used travel passes for economy or because they were old age pensioners. Fewer had their own transport, finding parking difficult and petrol expensive. Some use both bus and Metro in one journey.
